content.div:
Another in the series of fantasy thrillers about the war between werewolves and vampires. Kate Beckinsale returns in her leather jumpsuit as the vampire killer, this time trying to rescue her daughter from an evil human plot. It's just less of the same.

Starring: Kate Beckinsale, Theo James, India Eisley

Rating: Two stars out of five

The age-old war of the vampires and the lycans -- the supernatural version of the Hatfields and McCoys, not to say the Leafs and the Senators -- resumes in Underworld: Awakening, an exercise in overkill that stands mostly as an opportunity to see Kate Beckinsale in her black leather jumpsuit one more time. This is very diverting, but with all due respect, if you're not Seth Rogen, who confessed to a massive erection while standing next to Miss Beckinsale at the Golden Globes, it's hardly worth it.

The fourth in the series, with more sequels hinted at, finds Beckinsale's vampirish death dealer Selene being captured while trying to flee a human war against both vampires and lycans, which is actually a euphemism for werewolves although it doesn't sound any better. Humans have declared a "mass cleansing" -- about time too. We had vampire all over the windows -- and Selene is swept up.

She awakens 12 years later in a laboratory where evil Dr. Lane (Stephen Rea) has been doing experiments on her DNA. Fortunately, her black jumpsuit is in a nearby closet, and before long she's in action again, using gun, knife, boots, axe and exploding Frisbees to battle her ferocious foes.

The most interesting thing about all this is the casting of Rea, one of several stale-dated British stars who are featured in the Underworld series, which seems to attract actors who couldn't land parts in all that Harry Potter brouhaha. As a villain, he replaces Michael Sheen, who always seemed a little fine-boned for the part anyway. Similarly, the vampire leader is now portrayed by Charles Dance, taking over from Bill Nighy, who had his head sliced open diagonally in a previous episode. If this was a Leafs-Senators story, that would be called "an upper-body injury."

Anyway, Selene finds that she and her missing lover Michael -- a hybrid of vampire and lycan who combined the best of each, kind of like a nectarine -- have produced a daughter, Eve (India Eisley), who is a hybrid as well. Just like here on planet Earth, hybrids are in great demand, so Selene and Eve must run for their lives, helped along by David (Theo Jones), another vampire who has gone underground during the great human purge.

This results in a touching family story with a note of spiritual crisis -- "I don't know what I believe in any more," says Selene -- that is enlivened by several scenes of people slicing their arms open or reaching right into other people's stomachs to avail themselves of organs.

There's also much running through nighttime streets and into underground vampire covens, much of it shot through a blue filter that makes things even murkier. Underworld: Awakening is a dark film, and the 3-D version -- except for an explosion or two that sends glass or particles of lycan-killing silver into the air -- is too muted to be worth much.

Two Swedish directors, Mans Marlind and Bjorn Stein, made this episode, and while neither is likely to be mistaken for Ingmar Bergman, there is a certain charm in some of the special effects. The lycans are disarmingly retro, as if they were moulded out of clay. They look like something Ray Harryhausen created for The 7th Voyage of Sinbad back in 1958. That one had a few sequels too, but at least it knew when to stop.

entry.title: Top 10 Least Sexy Vampires

link.Abstract: For every shirtless Robert Pattinson, pop culture has also given us a Leslie Nielsen. Here are just 10 vampires who are unsexy enough to put you on Team Jacob.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Just because Edward Cullen and the vampires of the Twilight Saga make your pants “sparkle” doesn’t mean that all bloodsuckers are boyfriend-material. Just like humans, every vampire is unique – by which we mean some of them are total uggos. For every shirtless Robert Pattinson, pop culture has also given us a Leslie Nielsen. Here are just 10 vampires that are unsexy enough to put you on Team Jacob.
link.title: Top 10 Least Sexy Vampires

link.Abstract: Edward Cullen doesn't love you, but these 12 other monsters could. Of course, half of them are just as likely to kill you. But ladies, they're single!
link.title: 12 Monsters That Are Dreamier Than Edward Cullen

link.Abstract: More on Twilight Saga: Eclipse
link.title: More on Twilight Saga: Eclipse
